intro: Tylostemon euryneurus, commonly known as the broad-leafed tylostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
